gptanswer:
We have that
\[\tan 15^\circ = \tan (45^\circ - 30^\circ) = \frac{\tan 45^\circ - \tan 30^\circ}{1 + \tan 45^\circ \tan 30^\circ}.\]Since $\tan 45^\circ = 1$ and $\tan 30^\circ = \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}},$ this becomes
\[\frac{1 - \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}}{1 + \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}} = \boxed{\sqrt{3} - 2}.\]
